channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: CFTC declares Ether as a commodity again in court filing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: The community is hopeful that the assertion by the CFTC will put to bed claims that staked coins are securities according to the Howey Test.

item.title: Apple to allow third-party app stores in windfall for NFTs and crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: In a win for crypto app developers, incoming EU laws will force Apple to permit alternative app stores and apps without the need to go through its App Store.

item.title: Algorand to support bank and insurance guarantees platform in Italy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: This is the first time an EU member state will use blockchain technology for bank and insurance guarantees, according to Algorand.

item.title: What Goldman Sachs' CEO misunderstands about private blockchains
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Omid Malekan
item.description: Blockchains aren’t meant to provide big banks with another venue for imposing new fees on users.

item.title: Crypto community members discuss bank run on Binance
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: According to CEO Changpeng Zhao, Binance has seen outflows of an estimated $1.14 billion from the exchange.

item.title: Ethereum rallies to $1,350, but derivatives metrics remain neutral to bearish
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Pro traders aren’t buying ETH’s recent rally and data shows they expect Ether price to retrace if Fed chair Powell takes a hawkish tone on Wednesday.

item.title: German crypto asset trading platform Bitcoin Group SE buys bank with full license
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Bankhaus von der Heydt has its own stablecoin and digital asset custody and tokenization services, but it was on the market for a while and almost went to BitMEX execs.

item.title: Binance net withdrawals topped $3.6B over the last 7 days: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The sudden uptick in outflows may have been caused by market makers leaving the exchange.

item.title: 'You can commit fraud in shorts and T-shirts in the sun,' says SDNY attorney on SBF indictment
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Damian Williams called on individuals who may have been involved in alleged illegal actions at FTX and Alameda to “come see us before we come see you,” hinting at future arrests.

item.title: Is DeFi back? GMX rallies toward all-time high and LOOKS price gains 30%
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: GMX and LOOKS have staged double-digit rallies in the last week as former BitMEX CEO Arthur Hayes revealed his investment thesis for both projects.

item.title: Breaking: SBF denied bail by Bahamas Magistrate Court judge
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Sam Bankman-Fried will remain in custody at the Bahamas Department of Corrections until Feb. 8, 2023.

item.title: Indictment against SBF unsealed, contains 8 counts of financial and elections fraud
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The indictment from the Southern District of New York names only Sam Bankman-Fried, but contains allegations of illegal activities by “individuals known and unknown” as well.

item.title: FTX hearing: US lawmakers criticize use of Quickbooks, creepy dough, and 'conscientious stupidity'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Some members of the U.S. House of Representatives questioned whether Sam Bankman-Fried’s actions at FTX and Alameda may have been willful or due to gross incompetence.

item.title: MetaMask Institutional, Cobo and Gnosis DAO team up for soulbound token project
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: A new soulbound NFT project from Cobo, MetaMask Institutional and Gnosis Safe is bringing new nonfungible exclusivity and proof of identity to users.

item.title: ConsenSys launches zkEVM private beta testnet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The software has received over 150,000 signups so far.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin price up today?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.category: is the Bitcoin bear market over
item.description: Bitcoin price is up, alongside the prices of stocks and altcoins, thanks to a “positive” CPI report.

item.title: 'Old money has all but fled,' Huobi co-founder discusses challenges of running $400M VC fund
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Jun launched the fund amidst the bear market this year and continues to invest in Web 3.0 companies.

item.title: Web3 game DOGAMÍ secures $14M total funding
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: DOGAMÍ's team says it hopes to develop the first Web3 mobile game for mainstream audiences.

item.title: Crypto hotspots continue to thrive despite FTX collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rachel Wolfson
item.description: Crypto-friendly cities throughout the world report growth and innovation despite recent events.

item.title: CFTC files lawsuit against Sam Bankman-Fried, FTX, and Alameda for fraud
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to the federal regulator, SBF and FTX companies "used FTX customer funds for a variety of personal expenditures" including real estate and private jets.

item.title: Can Bitcoin survive a Carrington Event knocking out the grid?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Aaron Wood

item.title: Markets Pro delivers up to 1,123% ROI with quant-style crypto analysis for investors
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: 25 of Markets Pro’s 45 strategies are beating buy-and-hold strategies, one of which has returned over 21,000% since 2021.

item.title: Bitcoin sees CPI volatility as lower inflation sends BTC price to $18K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Inflation undercuts expectations, but Bitcoin remains at risk of fallout from a risk asset "deflationary panic" in Q1 next year, one analyst warns.

item.title: Decentralized solutions for climate change are key as COP disappoints
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Climate change initiatives led by politicians and sponsored by some of the biggest polluters demand a change in initiatives — Decentralized tech could play a key role.

item.title: Ledger hardware wallet adds DeFi tracking feature
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The Ledger Live app, which pairs with Ledger hardware wallets, integrated a new DeFi tracking feature to monitor performance analytics of over 1,000 protocols.

item.title: Gamers are more interested in earning Bitcoin than NFTs: Survey
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The study found that compared to NFTs, five times more respondents are interested in earning Bitcoin while playing games.

item.title: Canada bans crypto leverage and margin trading after FTX collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Now-bankrupt exchange FTX attempted to enter Canada in June 2022, but local regulators have managed to prevent the mess.

item.title: Bahamas reportedly asked SBF to mint new coin after FTX collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The FTX collapse has reportedly fueled a major international legal dispute between the United States and the Commonwealth of the Bahamas.

item.title: SEC charges former FTX CEO SBF for defrauding investors a day after his arrest
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: SEC has filed charges against the former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, accusing him of defrauding U.S. customers and concealing the diversion of customers’ funds.

item.title: SBF planned to blame everyone but himself, shows leaked Congress testimony
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: SBF blamed the current CEO, his legal counsel, the law firm he appointed for bankruptcy and Binance CEO CZ, without admitting any wrong on his part.
